page.title: 05MONT ORGUEIL CASTLE (4)
page.content: We arrive now in the{Middle Ward. Facing southwards we come to the Iron Age rampart, then in the same ward we enter the quaint{St. George's Chapel,} built in the 13th century, with its uneven floor and four squat pillars reaching for the low ceiling. On the left as you enter you see a solid stone altar with five crosses engraved on the granite top, representing the five wounds of Christ. Out of the Chapel and plodding on up the granite steps we pass the mighty{Somerset Tower,}built to defend the old{Keep}when cannon became a menace, and then we arrive at the well, where a stone has to drop 57 feet through the depths to the fresh water at the bottom. It was originally open to the sky, but was roofed over in the 17th century.
